Vrep Base Environment¶

NOTES: Because it makes more sense to create different goal conditions for the AI, this environment will be modified to contain the robot implementation + sensor-noise and the domain-dynamics randomization. The goal tasks will be defined by wrappers that build upon this script. The goal conditions are defiend by self._compute_reward() and self._sample_goal()

class rl_environments.vrep.balancebot_vrep_env_noise.BalanceBotVrepEnvNoise(server_addr='127.0.0.1', server_port=19997, scene_path='C:\Program Files\V-REP3\V-REP_PRO\scenes/balance_bot_ram.ttt')[source]¶
compute_action(action)[source]¶

Transform the action vector

The predicted action can be a rotation and translation vector, these need to be transformed into power of the motors.

Parameters

action – predicted action

Returns

Action in the form of ratio of motor power -1 to 1

compute_reward()[source]¶

This function calculates the reward based on the observation list.

Reward := (w_1 * a + w_2 * b + w_3 * c + ….) / (sum(w_1, w_2, w_3, ….) In this function a, b, c are different values calculated from the observation list these values are the quantificaiton of desired behavior. The values have a maximum of 1. w_x is the weight for each value and is used to indicate the priority of the different values

Returns

reward value

remap_observations()[source]¶

Linear remapping of the input range to a defined output range

reset()[source]¶

Gym environment ‘reset’

Stops the simulation if it is still running. Subsequently the environment is started anew.

Returns

observation vector

sample_goal()[source]¶

Samples the goal space for an XY coordinates

Returns

numpy float array

step(action)[source]¶

Gym environment ‘step’

rl_environments.vrep.balancebot_vrep_env_noise.main(args)[source]¶

main function used as test and example. Agent takes random actions using ‘env.action_space.sample()’
